result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Amending Count 1 from 1st Offense to 2nd Offense.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED: the State's Motion for Leave to File Amended Information is granted and the State is permitted to file an Amended Information as proposed in the motion.

State's Motion to Amend Count 1 of Information

Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.

(Case called at 10:26 AM- by Zoom) Defendant David J Allen appeared by video with Attorney Jay E. Heit. Attorney Trenton John Piltz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense is waiting for test results- requests jury trial be scheduled. 
Counsel to schedule Jury Trial and Final Status Conference with Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:07 AM Defendant David J Allen in court.  Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for David J Allen.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense has received discovery and has reviewed it. State indicates there is additional discovery coming. Parties would like a status conference.

Order on Stipulation for Protective Order

Proposed Order on Stipulation for Protective Order
Stipulation for Protective Order

(Case called at 9:30 AM) 
Defendant David J Allen in court with Attorney Jay E. Heit.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defense received a flash drive containing information from a computer, but is still without the Facebook messages and SANE records - may request an in-camera review as to those documents to determine relevancy.  State has no objection to an in-camera review as to the messages between the victim and the Defendant only; not all messages of the victim's Facebook account.  State will provide what it has available (SANE findings) and will provide other items as soon as possible.  Stipulation and order for SANE findings will be eFiled.
Status Conference: July 12, 2022 at 11:00 AM
Defendant's Supplemental Motion to Compel Discovery
Motion hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
of Jay Heit in Support of Plaintiff's Motion to Compel Discovery
to Compel Discovery (filed by Defense)
Status conference on June 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 2:28 PM.
Defendant David J Allen in court with Attorney Jay E. Heit.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea on the Defendant's behalf. Court grants 40 days to file motions.
STC: 6/21/22 at 10:30 AM.
State's Motion in Limine - Rape Shield Issue(s)
Preliminary Hearing, 03/15/2022

2:11 PM Defendant David J Allen appeared in court, Attorney Jay E. Heit for David J Allen appeared in court, Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

State asks the Court to find a transactional relationship between Count 1 and Count 2 with supporting argument. Defense requests that State provide testimony as to all counts. Court finds a transactional relationship between the counts. 

State calls Detective Ryan Lambeseder, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies defendant. Cross examination by Defense. Witness is excused. 
Arguments by counsel. 

Court finds Probable Cause and binds the matter over. Arraignment: 04/25/22 at 2:30pm 15 min in person.
Arraignment on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant David J Allen appeared in court, Attorney Jay E. Heit appeared in court for David J Allen.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
